test-cases.title: Product Search Functionality Test 1
test-cases.description: Test the product search feature with various search terms and filters to ensure accurate results
test-cases.feature_description: Enhanced product search and filtering capabilities for e-commerce platform
test-cases.acceptance_criteria: Given a user on the search page, when they enter search terms and apply filters, then relevant products matching criteria should be displayed
test-cases.preconditions: Product catalog is populated with test data

test_steps.expected_result: Search page loads with search input field and filter options visible

test_steps.action: Enter product name in search field
test_steps.expected_result: Auto-suggestions appear showing relevant product matches
Search results are filtered to show only products within the specified price range
All displayed products match the search criteria and price filter

test-cases.expected_result: Search returns accurate, filtered product results

test-cases.title: Shopping Cart Management Test
test-cases.description: Verify that users can add, update, and remove items from their shopping cart successfully
test-cases.feature_description: Shopping cart management and persistence functionality
test-cases.acceptance_criteria: Given a logged-in user, when they add items to cart and manage quantities, then cart should accurately reflect changes and persist across sessions
test-cases.preconditions: User is logged in and products are available for purchase

test_steps.expected_result: Product is added to cart, cart count shows 2 items, total shows $1,998
test_steps.test_data: Product: iPhone 15 Pro, Quantity: 2, Price: $999 each

test_steps.expected_result: Cart quantity updates to 3, total price updates to $2,997
Product is completely removed from cart, cart becomes empty, total shows $0
Cart remains empty after page refresh

test-cases.expected_result: Cart management functions correctly with proper persistence

test_case.title: User Login Authentication Test
test_case.description: Verify that users can successfully log in with valid credentials

test_case.title: Product Search Functionality Test
test_case.description: Test the product search feature with various search terms and filters

jira-tickets.description: As a user, I want to be able to log into the system securely so that I can access my personal dashboard and protected features. The system should validate credentials and provide appropriate feedback for both successful and failed login attempts.
jira-tickets.acceptance_criteria: Given a user with valid credentials, when they attempt to log in, then they should be successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard.
acceptanceCriteria: User can enter email and password on login form
System validates credentials against user database
User is redirected to dashboard on successful authentication
Clear error message displayed for invalid credentials
Account lockout implemented after 5 consecutive failed attempts
Password requirements enforced (minimum 8 characters, special characters)

jira-tickets.description: Develop an advanced product search feature with multiple filter options including price range, category, brand, and rating.
jira-tickets.acceptance_criteria: Given a user on the search page, when they enter search terms and apply filters, then relevant products matching criteria should be displayed.

jira-tickets.description: Implement comprehensive shopping cart functionality that allows users to manage their selected items efficiently.
jira-tickets.acceptance_criteria: Given a logged-in user, when they add items to cart and manage quantities, then cart should accurately reflect changes and persist across sessions.
